availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James K. Rogers (Union County, Tennessee, farmer)

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, farmer. Tennessee native. Father of Creed F. Rogers, James H. Rogers, Sarah M. Rogers, Mary V. Rogers, Rachel C. Rogers, Littea L. Rogers. Married Eliza Lajara Rogers in Claiborne County, Tennessee on June 18, 1842. Farmer in Claiborne County, Tennessee in 1850. Farmer in Union County, Tennessee in 1860. Juror in the State V. William B. Chapman in May 1861.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Claiborne County, p. 667.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Union County, District 11, p. 489. Find A Grave, "James K. Rogers (April 6, 1810-June 27, 1889)," Memorial #43816600, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43816600(accessed January 30, 2020). Tennessee, Marriage Records, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Claiborne County Marriages, p. 41. KYR-0001-021-0031
